results.title: The Self
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
The Self, or self concept, is the individual’s awareness of his or her continuing identity as a person. It acts as an internal regulator of thoughts, feelings and behaviour which interprets and organises our ongoing experiences. It reflects on how our present actions compare with our standards and expectations - and it affects our performance by providing plans, scripts and incentives. In this program, Philip Zimbardo examines the psychology of Self, including the theories of William James, Freud’s categories of id, ego and superego, Carl Rogers humanistic psychology of self and Albert Bandura’s theory of self-efficacy.

results.title: Motivation and emotion
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
Motivation is the general term for all the physical and psychological processes that start behaviour, maintain it and stop it. What motivates people to do good … or evil? Psychology professor, Philip Zimbardo, of Stanford University, discusses why we act and feel as we do, exploring the biological and sociological aspects of motivation and its relation to our emotions, as well as the constant tension existing between desire and restraint, particularly in relation to sexual attraction.

results.title: The Drover's wife
results.brief_description: From Henry Lawson via Russell Drysdale - The Australian myth of The Drover’s Wife retold from a different perspective. Story retold by Murray Bail. Based on Henry Lawson’s original story and inspired by Drysdale’s painting of the same name this film explores women’s invisibility in our cultural history. What is so wonderful about this program is not only that it uses a wide variey of commentators and visual and literay sources, but it is positive and free of professional jargon. Cast features Martin Vaughan. Won Silver Award and Special Award for Acting in the General Category at the AFI Awards.

results.title: The Developing child
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
How much do we know when we come into the world? Rousseau believed we came into the world with all the skills needed for survival, and were then warped by our contact with society. John Locke, however, saw young babies as a blank screen to be developed by life’s experience. This began the “nature versus nurture” debate in human psychology. Philip Zimbardo, in this program, investigates current evidence to decide whether heredity or environment is the major factor in a child’s development.

results.title: The Driver
results.creator_credit: Walter Hill, Lawrence Gordon, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: Ryan O’Neal is the superstar getaway driver and Bruce Dern is the detective obsessed with capturing the speed maniac regardless of the costs. The Driver is well aware of the cop chasing him and leaves a tantalising trail of evidence in a game in which there can only be one victor. This film is notable for its high octane value, rather than a thoughtful character study with lots of dialogue. Cast also includes Isabelle Adjani as a gambler hired as an alibi for the driver.

results.title: The Dresser
results.brief_description: The compelling study of the intense relationship between the exhausted and aging leader of a wartime Shakespearian company, “Sir” (Albert Finney), and his homosexual dresser, Norman (Tom Courtenay). Adapted by Ronald Harwood from his own play, “The Dresser” is based on the touring career of Donald Wolfit whose dresser the author was. A film rich in comedy, compassion and love for the theatre.

results.title: The Dreamlife of angels = La Vie revee des anges
results.creator_credit: Erick Zonca, Francois Marquis, Diaphana Films, France 3 Cinema and Les Productions Bagheera
results.brief_description: Erick Zonca’s feature film debut is a subtle, unflinching, yet compassionate look at the relationship between two young women - Isa (Elodie Bouchez) and Marie (Natacha Regnier), who meet while working as machinists in Lille. The two are diametrically different in appearance, attitude towards life, family and friends, and most significantly in relation towards men and Sandrine; a comatose young girl (Sandrine’s mother owns the flat that Isa and Marie are minding). There are moments of real happiness between the two, and the initial stages of their friendship as it develops is captured beautifully, allowing the viewer to absorb the expressions of each girl and speculate about character development. Their paths soon begin to diverge however - unbalancing their friendship, when Marie becomes involved in a self destructive relationship with night club owner Chris (Gregoire Colin), and Isa starts to visit Sandrine after finding the girl’s diary and becoming privy to her innermost thoughts. As the friends drift further away from one another, they are both faced with situations that challenge them and influence their future both as individuals, and as friends. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Dreaming age = Meng huan shi jie
results.creator_credit: Lin Hongtong and Children's Film Studio (China)
results.brief_description:
Little Luo Fei, a middle-school student, is affected deeply by the changes brought about in her family by the arrival of Hua Guang, a famous musician and her mother’s erstwhile boyfriend.

Credits: Director, Lin Hongtong.
Cast: Wang Chunzi, Lou Jicheng

results.title: The Dreaming
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Wayne Groom, Craig Lahiff, Genesis Films, International Film Management and FGH Film Consortium
results.brief_description: Two hundred years ago bands of whalers roamed the oceans. In the Great Southern Land of Australia they discovered natives who cherished a mystical power called the Dreaming - a knowledge handed down from the beginning of their world. The whalers were bloodthirsty men, responsible for rapes killings and massacres - a taint upon the Dreaming. This taint lives on into the present and a new nightmare when a burial ground is unearthed, a girl dies, an ancient curse is revived and a young doctor becomes inextricably involved in a chain of supernatural events that point towards death. Starring Arthur Dignam, Penny Cook, Gary Sweet, Laurence Clifford and Kristina Nehm. Based on a story by Craig Lahiff and Terry Jennings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mario Andreacchio, Wayne Groom, Craig Lahiff, Genesis Films, International Film Management and FGH Film Consortium

results.title: The Dreaming
results.creator_credit: Judy Campbell, Geoffrey Collings, Dahl Collings and Collings Productions
results.brief_description: An exploration of Australian First Nations rock paintings in Arnhem Land that attempts to capture the cultural and spiritual significance and meaning of the art to the local peoples.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Judy Campbell, Geoffrey Collings, Dahl Collings and Collings Productions
